page.title: 20CHANGING TIMES
page.content: In the last 20 years the mills have gone out of business in the D-block area.A new radio mast was bulit at Pole Moor to replace the old one.A society is also trying to re-open the canal from Marsden to Huddersfield. This is supposed to take 15 years.Slaithwaite now has a leisure centre and a swimming bath which was opened in the sixties. Marsden has a railway station and Slaithwaite had one opened in 1983. Before motorised transport people used to travel by horse and cart down and up the valley.The main road running through the area is the A62 which used to be one of the main roads across the Pennines.In the early 1970's the trans-Pennine motorway the M62 was opened.{ {Ben Wade (age 11)}
